cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Ethereal Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A misty, fog-bound dimension that overlaps multiple planes and provides passage between them via curtains of vaporous color in its depths.

physicalProperties.shape: The Border Ethereal overlaps the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes. The Deep Ethereal is a region of swirling mist and fog containing curtains of vaporous color.

timeFlow.description: Distance is meaningless in the Deep Ethereal. Travelers feel as if they can move by a simple act of will, but it's impossible to measure speed and hard to track the passage of time. A trip through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at their normal speeds.

hazards.name: Ether Cyclone
hazards.description: An ether cyclone is a serpentine column that spins through the plane. The cyclone appears abruptly, distorting and uprooting everything in its path and carrying the debris for miles. Travelers with a Passive Perception score of 15 or higher receive 1 minute of warning: a deep thrum in the ethereal matter. Travelers who can't reach a curtain or portal leading elsewhere suffer the cyclone's effect.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

entries.description: Each character in a group traveling together makes a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by 1d10 hours. Otherwise, the journey's travel time is doubled.

entries.effect: Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal
entries.description: Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (roll on the Ethereal Curtains table).
Hurled to a random destination on the Astral Plane.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When the ether cyclone's location effect result is 1–12 (Extended journey), each character makes the saving throw. If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by 1d10 hours; otherwise journey travel time is doubled.

onFailure.description: If fewer than half the group succeeds, the journey's travel time is doubled.

onSuccess.description: If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by only 1d10 hours instead of doubling.

environmentalEffects.name: Border Ethereal Visibility
environmentalEffects.description: Visibility in the Border Ethereal is usually limited to 60 feet. From the Border Ethereal, a traveler can see into whatever plane it overlaps, but that plane appears grayish and indistinct, its colors blurring into each other and its edges turning fuzzy, limiting visibility to 30 feet into the other plane. Conversely, the Ethereal Plane is usually imperceptible to those on the overlapped planes, except with the aid of magic.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Visibility limited to 60 feet in the Border Ethereal. Visibility into the overlapped plane limited to 30 feet. Creatures in the Border Ethereal are imperceptible to those on the overlapped plane without magic. Solid objects on the overlapped plane don't hamper movement. Creatures in the Border Ethereal can't attack creatures on the overlapped plane and vice versa, except via certain magical effects (including anything made of magical force) and living beings.

lightModification.colorDescription: Grayish and indistinct when viewing overlapped plane

environmentalEffects.name: Deep Ethereal Visibility
environmentalEffects.description: The plane's depths comprise a region of swirling mist and fog called the Deep Ethereal, where visibility is usually limited to 30 feet.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Visibility limited to 30 feet in the Deep Ethereal. Scattered throughout are curtains of vaporous color leading to the Border Ethereal of specific planes.

lightModification.colorDescription: Swirling mist and fog with scattered curtains of vaporous color

environmentalEffects.name: Ethereal Curtains
environmentalEffects.description: Scattered throughout the Deep Ethereal are curtains of vaporous color. Passing through a curtain leads a traveler to a region of the Border Ethereal connected to a specific Inner Plane, the Material Plane, the Feywild, or the Shadowfell. The color of the curtain indicates the plane whose Border Ethereal the curtain conceals. The curtains are also distinguishable by texture and temperature, each one reflecting something of the nature of the plane beyond.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Passing through an ethereal curtain transports the traveler from the Deep Ethereal to the Border Ethereal of the indicated plane. A trip through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at their normal speeds. Curtain color, texture, and temperature identify the destination plane. The Ethereal Curtains table (d12) determines which plane a curtain leads to when randomly determined.

environmentalEffects.name: Border Ethereal Movement Properties
environmentalEffects.description: The Ethereal Plane disobeys the laws of gravity; a creature there can freely move in any direction. Normally, creatures in the Border Ethereal can't attack creatures on the overlapped plane, and vice versa. Solid objects on the overlapped plane don't hamper movement. The exceptions are certain magical effects (including anything made of magical force) and living beings.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: No gravity; free movement in any direction. Solid objects on the overlapped plane do not impede movement. Creatures are imperceptible to those on the overlapped plane without magic. Exceptions: magical effects (including magical force) and living beings can interact across the boundary. This makes the Ethereal Plane ideal for scouting, spying, and moving undetected.

gravityModel.description: The Ethereal Plane disobeys the laws of gravity; a creature there can freely move in any direction.

notableEntities.name: Radiant Citadel
notableEntities.description: A living relic of the ingenuity and collaboration of twenty-seven great civilizations on the Material Plane. A floating city carved from a single massive fossil around a colossal gemstone shard known as the Auroral Diamond. In the haze of the Ethereal Plane, the Auroral Diamond is a scintillating beacon visible from miles away.

civilizations.name: Radiant Citadel
civilizations.description: A nexus of diplomacy and trade, a repository of histories and secrets, and a thriving sanctuary for those seeking safety or a better life. Heroes and paupers meet on equal footing. Power and resources are equitably shared.

specialRules.name: Deep Ethereal Travel Time
specialRules.description: Traveling through the Deep Ethereal is unlike physical travel. Distance is meaningless, so although travelers feel as if they can move by a simple act of will, it's impossible to measure speed and hard to track the passage of time.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: A trip through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of the origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at their normal speeds.

specialRules.name: Ethereal Curtain Identification
specialRules.description: Ethereal curtains are curtains of vaporous color scattered throughout the Deep Ethereal. The color of the curtain indicates the plane whose Border Ethereal the curtain conceals. The curtains are also distinguishable by texture and temperature, each one reflecting something of the nature of the plane beyond.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Roll d12 on the Ethereal Curtains table to determine which plane a randomly encountered curtain leads to. Material Plane curtains are turquoise (1-2), Shadowfell is dusky gray (3), Feywild is opalescent (4), Air is pale blue (5), Earth is chestnut (6), Fire is orange (7), Water is green (8), Ash is dark gray (9), Ice is aquamarine (10), Magma is maroon (11), Ooze is chocolate (12).

specialRules.name: Ether Cyclone and Curtain Interaction
specialRules.description: Travelers who sense an approaching ether cyclone (Passive Perception 15+, 1 minute warning) can attempt to reach a curtain or portal to escape. Those who can't reach a curtain or portal suffer the cyclone's effect. On a d20 roll of 13-19, the cyclone blows travelers to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (determined by rolling on the Ethereal Curtains table).
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Ether cyclone result 13-19 on d20: Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane. Roll on the Ethereal Curtains table (d12) to determine which plane. Reaching a curtain before the cyclone strikes allows escape from its effects.

globalPlanarConnections.name: Ethereal Curtain Network
globalPlanarConnections.description: Scattered throughout the Deep Ethereal are curtains of vaporous color. Passing through a curtain leads a traveler to a region of the Border Ethereal connected to a specific Inner Plane, the Material Plane, the Feywild, or the Shadowfell. The color of the curtain indicates the plane whose Border Ethereal the curtain conceals. The curtains are also distinguishable by texture and temperature, each one reflecting something of the nature of the plane beyond.
hazards: Ether cyclones can blow travelers to random curtain destinations
navigableBy: Any creature in the Deep Ethereal

planarTravelMethods.name: Ethereal Curtain Passage
planarTravelMethods.description: Curtains of vaporous color scattered throughout the Deep Ethereal serve as portals to the Border Ethereal of the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes. Each curtain's color, texture, and temperature indicate which plane it leads to. Passing through a curtain transports the traveler to the Border Ethereal overlapping that plane.
requirements: Must be in the Deep Ethereal
Must locate an ethereal curtain of the desired color
risks: Ether cyclones can divert, delay, or blow travelers to random curtain destinations
Travel time of 1d10 × 10 hours between curtains regardless of origin and destination
Visibility limited to 30 feet in the Deep Ethereal

planarTravelMethods.name: Etherealness Spell
planarTravelMethods.description: Characters can use the Etherealness spell to enter the Border Ethereal.

planarTravelMethods.name: Plane Shift to Ethereal
planarTravelMethods.description: The Plane Shift spell allows transport to the Border Ethereal or the Deep Ethereal, but unless the intended destination is a specific location or a teleportation circle, the point of arrival could be anywhere on the plane.
requirements: Ability to cast Plane Shift spell
risks: Point of arrival could be anywhere on the plane unless targeting a specific location or teleportation circle
